passages.context: The Beatitudes and The Sermon on The Mount
St. Paul on spiritual combat and the promise of future glory.

passages.message: Letting go of anxiety and instead praying to God and trusting in Him. God's peace surpasses all understanding.
passages.context: St. Paul's exhorations to the Phillipians.

passages.message: The Mirror that is the Law
passages.context: St. Paul on the doctrine of salvation.

passages.message: A recognition of God's supremacy and His goodness. A person should not be followed as God is and divisions should not be spread because one person is evangelized by one instead of another. Rather, everyone should follow God in the best way possible, not simply the people who led them to Him.
passages.context: People in Corinth who caused divisions by claiming to follow preachers rather than the One whom they were preaching.

passages.message: God's love ifor us is so great that He gave up even His Son for us.
passages.context: A summary of God's love and plan given to by Jesus to Nicodemus

passages.message: Beware so as not to believe that you are responsible for your blessings, for even the power that you used to obtain them has been given to you.
passages.context: A warning not to forget God in good times
